etymology.description: 不(not) + 得了(can manage/finish) = cannot be handled; hence overwhelmingly great/serious.
etymology.interpretation: Originally meant something so serious it can’t be dealt with, hence ‘terrible’ or ‘disastrous’. In modern speech it also intensifies adjectives/verbs to mean ‘extremely; amazingly’ depending on context, positive or negative.

parts.english: to finish;to understand;to be able to;to end

examples.chinese: 今天热得不得了(今天熱得不得了)。
他高兴得不得了(他高興得不得了)。
出了这么大的事故，麻烦不得了(出了這麼大的事故，麻煩不得了)。
examples.pinyin: Chūle zhème dà de shìgù, máfan bùdéliǎo.
examples.english: With such a major accident, the trouble is immense.
